S.A.L Sister Company Arab Bank (Switzerland) LimitedEnglishالعربية HomeFAQsFAQsServicesHow can I open an account with the Arab Bank? Do I need to fill out application forms or can I do that through the Internet?You can open an account at any of the Arab Bank branches throughout the world and whose addresses are available on our global website. Contact the required branch to furnish you with the information, application forms and the required documents applicable at each location. It is not possible to open an account at the relevant branch through the Internet.I have an account with the Arab Bank. Can I inquire and obtain any information about this account through the Internet?You may inquire about your account and obtain many other services through the Internet by free subscribing to the Direct-On-Line Banking Service offered to Arab Bank customers. By using a PIN number and user ID code designated to each customer upon registration, this service enables you to inquire not only your balance but also about movements in any of your accounts, request checkbooks, request details on movements of deposits and loans, make internal transfers between your accounts, make transfers within the Arab Bank branches or , bill payment and change your address.In case you desire to obtain service please Contact our Customer Contact Center or your branch to supply you with the appropriate application form.What is the best way to transfer funds to my account with the Arab Bank in Palestine?You may transfer funds to your Arab Bank account in Palestine by requesting your bank to make the transfer through the Arab Bank branch located in your area, or directly to the "Central Transfer Unit of the Arab Bank-Palestine (ARABPS22XXX)". You should indicate your full name, account number and name of your branch.How can I transfer funds to my account with the Arab Bank in Jordan? How long such a transfer takes and how much would it cost me?You can transfer funds to your account with Arab Bank in Jordan by contacting and informing your local bank of your desire to execute the transfer through the Arab Bank branch in the same area (if available), or execute the transfer directly to the "Central Transfers Unit of the Arab Bank-Jordan (ARABJOAX100)". You should indicate your full name, account number and name of your branch. The transfer amount will be deposited in your account on the same day of receipt or in accordance with the regulations of the bank that executed the transfer. Costs of transfers are subject to local laws and regulations.Visa Cards & ATMsDo I always have to use my Personal Identification Number (PIN)?The PIN is used at ATMs. It may be required on POS in some countries.Can I change my PIN?You can change your Visa Electron PIN at any Arab Bank ATM. As for your Classic/ Gold cards, you should inform your branch, in order to issue a new PIN.How can I obtain a Visa Card?The Arab Bank offers its customers the Visa Card Service (Gold / Classic and Electron). Please refer to your branch or Call Center, which will provide you with the relevant terms and conditions.How can I use the Arab Bank Visa Electron card?Visa Electron card is used to pay for purchases and services at merchants/ service centres equipped with POS devices carrying the Electron logo worldwide, by direct debit to your account. It is also used to withdraw cash and inquire about the card balance on ATMs holding the Visa logo worldwide. Full range of Arab Bank ATM services in the country of issuance are offered to Visa Electron cardholders.Are there any commissions for using the card?No commission is charged if the card is used locally. If the card is used internationally, F.X commission of 2-3% is charged, as assigned for each area. Cash advance fees are charged if the card (Gold/ Classic) is used to withdraw cash.What is the difference between Electron card and the Visa Classic and Gold cards?Visa Electron card is issued free of charge, and is used to withdraw cash or pay for the purchases up to the available balance of the account. The customer’s account shall be debited directly with all transactions. The card is subject to the daily limits assigned for each area. Charge cards provide the customers with a monthly limit which is renewed at the beginning of each card cycle. This means the customer can use the full limit of the card each month. The total amount of the card’s transactions shall be debited to the customer’s account at the end of the card cycle. Credit cards are issued with a certain limit. However, payments are made in installments.What shall I do if my card is lost or stolen?Notify your branch immediately. If your Visa card (Gold or Classic) is lost or stolen, you can inform alternatively Arab Bank Visa Centre which provides its services 24 hours/ 7 days a week on +973 17 29 10 29, (collect if available in the country you are calling from).Inside Jordan you can contact Arab Bank Call Centre on (4600900), to report the loss/theft of your Visa card. Protect your card as if it were cash. Do not write down your PIN, memorize it.Arabi OnlineI pressed the Online Banking icon the error message "This page cannot be displayed" appears.Microsoft Internet ExplorerOpen Internet Explorer and select from the "Tools" menu the "Internet Options" option. In the dialogue box that appears, select the "Advanced" tab found at the top. Go down in the list until you find the Security section. Make sure that the following options are both checked: - "Use SSL 2.0" - "Use SSL 3.0" Then press the button "OK". Close the browser.Netscape NavigatorSelect the Communicator menu. Select Tools. Select Security Info. In the dialogue box that appears, under Security Info, select Navigator. Under "Advanced Security (SSL) Configuration". Make sure that the check boxes are both checked. Click the button "Configure SSL v2". Check all of the choices. Click the button "Configure SSL v3". Check all of the choices other than "No encryption with an MD5 MAC".When you enter a password or a Token-generated password, you are logged out automatically.Five consecutive wrong password entries while you are confirming your transaction will cause the service to exit and return to the Login screen.The browser stops at the page "Checking if installation is up to date" or the new window appears and "Dear Customer Please wait while the Online Banking special software is being loaded" and the login screen does not appear.Microsoft Internet Explorer ver5.0.Open Internet Explorer and select from the 'Tools', 'Internet Options' option. In the dialogue box that appears, select the 'Advanced' tab found at the top. Go down in the list until you find the Java VM section, if you cannot find it, then you need to install the Java Virtual Machine for your browser (consult the help of Internet Explorer to learn how to install the Java Virtual Machine).The new window appears but the text does not show meaningful text ">unknown text<".Microsoft Internet ExplorerIn the white area displayed on the right side of the window, right-click your mouse.While holding down the 'Shift' key, select 'Refresh' option from the menu.NetscapeIn the white area displayed on the left side / top of the window, right-click your mouse.While holding down the 'Shift' key, select 'Reload' option from the menu.I received the PIN mailer and the Branch has activated my account but I get a message 'Invalid login'.The password consists of numbers only while the User-ID is case-sensitive. They must be entered as they appear on the PIN mailer. Pay attention to '1' and 'l' or '0' and 'O' (for the User-ID).You could have forgot your password and you need to get a new PIN mailer from your branch.When I try to log in a message appears "Your account is inactive?".Your account is not activated yet. You need to contact your branch to activate your account or call our Customer Contact Center.When I try to log in a message appears "Your account is locked ".Your account was locked as a combination of your user-ID and a wrong password were entered five consecutive times.I am unable to get the login screen even though the SSL options are activated, and I am using a proxy.Microsoft Internet ExplorerOpen Internet Explorer and select from the 'Tools' menu the 'Internet Options' option.In the dialogue box that appears, select the 'Connections' tab found at the top.Click the 'LAN Settings...' button.In the secured connection fields, make sure you have the proxy and port set correctly. Or, alternately, if you are using the same proxy configuration for all type of connection, you may check the option 'Use the same proxy server for all protocols'.Netscape NavigatorOpen Netscape and select from the 'Edit' menu the 'Preferences' option.In the box that appears, under 'Category', click the plus sign next to 'Advanced', 'Cache', 'Proxies' and 'SmartUpdate' appear.Select 'Proxies'.Click the button 'View'.In the Secured Connection fields, make sure that you have the proxy and port set correctly.I click "Login" on the website, the new window appears and "Please wait .." appears but the login screen does not appear. Make sure that the browser you are using is Internet ExplorerTM 4.0 / Internet ExplorerTM v4.5 Apple Edition and above, or Netscape 4.4 and above. To find out you browser's version: From your browser's window select the Help menu.From your browser's window select the Help menu.Select the last item "About ...'.Select the last item "About ...'.If you are using Microsoft Internet Explorer then a new box appears displaying the version. If you are using Netscape, then the version will appear in a new page.If you are using Microsoft Internet Explorer then a new box appears displaying the version. If you are using Netscape, then the version will appear in a new page.Tip: You may use the "Check Browser" option available on the website to check if your browser version or screen resolution is compatible.2. Make sure that your browser supports Java If you are using Netscape, please ignore this step.Tip: You may use the "Check Browser" option available on the website to check if your browser version or screen resolution is compatible.For Microsoft Internet Explorer Only:Open Internet Explorer and select from the 'Tools', 'Internet Options' option.In the dialogue box that appears, select the 'Advanced' tab found at the top.Go down in the list until you find the Java VM section, if you cannot find it, then you need to install the Java Virtual Machine for your browser (consult the help of Internet Explorer to learn how to install the Java Virtual Machine).I logged in for the first time, I change password and User-ID, but I still at the same screen.The user-ID and password(s) must each be six to ten character long. The password must contain at least one special character (! $ % &' ( ) * + , - . / @ : = ?) and at least one alphanumeric. Also, if the user has a second password, then the login password and second password cannot be identical!After successful change of your password(s) & User ID the system would lead you to view your 'Balance Summary', then the User-ID & password (s) has changed and you have to use the new to login again.When you start to use the service, a page appears displaying a message "Incompatibilities Detected".Please make sure that your screen resolution is 800 X 600 or above:From the 'Start' menu, select 'Settings' then 'Control Panel'.Double click the 'Display' icon.In the Display Properties box select the settings tab.Select the Desktop Area (or Screen Area) to be 800*600 pixels or moreMake sure that the browser you are using is Internet ExplorerTM 4.0 / Internet ExplorerTM v4.5 Apple? Edition and above, or Netscape? 4.4 and above.To find out you browser's version: From your browser's window select the Help menu Select the last item 'About?'If you are using Microsoft Internet Explorer then a new box appears displaying the version. If you are using Netscape, then the version will appear in a new page.How can I Apply for the Service?The customer either visitthe branch to sign the agreement and select the services.Apply via Arab Bank website and visit the branch to sign the agreement. Through our Customer Contact Center to issue the service and visit the branch to sign the agreement. For customers living abroad,contact branch to ask about non-residence customer producers.I am unable to make any transfer.Make sure that you do not exceed your daily transfer limit, which is defined in the help page 'Daily Transfer Limit'. Use the 'Currency Calculator' to estimate the amount in your local currency. Also, note that the daily transfer limit applies to all the Internal and External transfers made each 24 hours.I opened a new sub account for a main account subscribed to the Internet Online Banking service. When I log in, I cannot see this account in the Balance Summary service.Log in to the service.Select "MY ACCOUNTS".Select "Manage My Accounts".Under the "Other Accounts" list, select the sub account. Press "Add" button, the sub account should be displayed under "On-Line Banking Accounts".Press the "ACCEPT" button.The applet takes a lot of time to get downloaded.Microsoft Internet ExplorerSelect Internet Options from Tools menu.Select Settings from Temporary Internet Files.Select View Objects.Select Arab Bank Online Banking Service.Select Delete from File menu.Re-login to the service.The login screen appears but after I log in the screen seems incomplete.Make sure that your screen resolution is 800 X 600 or above:From the "Start" menu, select "Settings" then "Control Panel".Double click the "Display" icon.In the Display Properties box select the settings tab.Select the Desktop Area (or Screen Area) to be 800*600 pixels or more.Tip: You may use the "Check Browser" option available on the website to check if your browser version or screen resolution is compatible.What are the available services that offered by Internet Banking?Personal ServicesAccounts Balance Summary.Account Statement.Fixed Deposits / Loans.Transfer of funds among the customer's accounts.Manage the enrolled Online Banking accounts.Change the account(s) address(s).View the activity log.Calculate the rate to transfer from one currency to another.Car lease calculators.Request a cheque book.Mail correspondence with the customer's branch.Visa card details.Third Party Payments ServiceInternal Transfer to other custome''s accounts at Arab bank of same counrty.External Transfer to other customer's accounts at local and International Banks.Scheduled Transfers other customer's accounts whether at Arab Bank, local or International Banks.What does Arab Bank offer to counteract all Internet Security Risks?High encryption technique to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of the information transmitted between the Bank and the Customer.Specialized security equipment to secure-up to our knowledge - that intruders cannot access / use the Online Banking equipment.Wrong entry of the User ID / Password repeatedly would entail the temporary suspension of the service, where the customer would have to refer to his branch to activate the service.While using the service, if a predefined time elapses without any activity, the customer will be disconnected automatically.The customer can always check his activity log to view the transactions, which he has requested previously.Request for financial/ sensitive transaction requires a password to confirm.The customer is forced to change his User-ID and password on first access to the service.Upon login, the service displays the customer's last access to the service.In "Manage Beneficiary", an arrow pointing to the Account Number and message " To process request please fill in or select the marked fields."For a local account in Arab Bank, six digits- basic account number (including the leading zeros, excluding check digit) and three digits- account type respectively in the corresponding fields.When I am trying to download the special software, I get a "Security Warning" dialog box, I press "Yes", but still I cannot get the software downloaded.Microsoft Internet ExplorerWhen the "Security Warning" dialog box appears, check the "Always trust content from Arab Bank" checkbox, then press "Yes".Note: This dialog box appears twice, follow the same procedure for both boxes.I use the service quite often, but each time I log in to the service it takes 2-3 minutes to display the “Login” screen.There is a problem with the Windows98 first release. You may update to Windows second release, WindowsNT, or any other supported operating system.I am trying to login, but the system keeps emptying the User-ID and password fields without any error messages.Microsoft Internet ExplorerIn the white area displayed on the right side of the window, right-click your mouse.While holding down the 'Shift' key, select 'Refresh' option from the menu.I am using a WindowsNT/Windows2000 workstation and trying to access the Service, a new window appears but it stays blank for a long time and nothing happens. Microsoft Internet ExplorerLogin to your workstation as an administrator, then access the Online Banking service. Now the latest version of the Online Banking Service software is downloaded. You can use it even if you log as a user without administrative privileges.What are the requirements to Access the Service?PC connected to the Internet.Browser (Microsoft Internal Explorer or Netscape Communicator). A User-ID and Password for personal Services. Or User-ID, Password and Token for personal and Third Party Payment Services.What is a Token?The Token is an electronic device with a numeric keypad and display panel operated with a PIN.The Token generates randomly passwords using time as one of the factors, the password is used to confirm financial / sensitive transactions.The generated password is valid for less than a minute; therefore the customer need not worry about the secrecy of the generated password.Hala ArabiHow can I obtain the Hala Arabi service? How much would it cost me?Hala Arabiservices are offered around the clock and free of charge to our customers when an account is opened or at any other time henceforth. This service allows customers to inquire about their account balances, their last ten movements, request checkbooks or statements of accounts or Bills Payments and to transfer money between accounts in the local Arab Bank branches. You can obtain this service free-of-charge by submitting a subscription application to your branch or by ContactCenter.Jordan Arab Bank PLC Jordan Palestine Egypt Lebanon UAE Qatar Bahrain Yemen Morocco Algeria China South Korea (Representative Office) Kazakhstan (Representative Office) Singapore Subsidiaries Europe Arab Bank plc Arab Bank Australia Limited Islamic international Arab Bank plc Arab National Leasing Company Al - Arabi Investment Group Co.(AB Invest) Arab Sudanese Bank Limited Al Arabi Investment Group / Palestine Acabes For Financial Technology Arab Tunisian Bank Al - Niser Al - Arabi Co. S.A.L Sister Company Arab Bank (Switzerland) LimitedEnglishالعربية Ways To Bank Arabi OnlineTerms & Conditions Terms & ConditionsThe Special Terms of Online Internet Banking Service (Arabi Online)DefinitionBank : Arab Bank plc or any branches abroad.Customer : A national or legal resident. In the singular or plural forms.Working Day : A day on which the Bank is open and provides its services.Service : The Online Internet Banking Service.These terms related to Online Internet Banking are applied in so far as they do not conflict with the Manual of General and Special Terms for Dealing with The Accounts and The Banking and Electronic Services.The Bank is offering this service through the Internet, utilizing the leading security measures, but the Bank is not responsible for any errors that may occur due to the unprotected and open nature of the Internet networks. Therefore, the customer shall be solely responsible for all risks inherent in, or resulting from using the service which the customer has subscribed to.The customer will be fully responsible for the maintenance of their PC, operations and communications costs.The customer will be responsible for any failure in hardware / software that customer uses to access the service or any software / hardware that may negatively affect service security and/or service effectiveness or any PC viruses that may expose customer's credentials.The customer may request to cancel the service by written request to the Bank. The Bank has the right to suspend the service at any time partially, and for any period of time without any prior notice to the customer, and without giving any reasons. In case the service is suspended completely the customer will be informed thereof.The Bank will not be responsible in the event of irregularity of the service, if non-operational or if inaccurate information is given through the service.The Bank may share information about the customer internally to provide the customer with information about new services.The Bank shall have the right not to perform any funds transfers if the customer does not have sufficient balance in the account he/she designated, at the time the order is to be performed, or if the transfer amount exceeds the daily transfer limit.Transfers are conducted automatically on the day specified by the customer if the transfer is to Arab Bank Branches in the same country, or on the following two "business days" if otherwise. The amount will be debited from the customer's account on execution day and at the prevailing exchange rate.The Bank shall have the right to change the daily transfer limit at anytime without prior customer's approval.The customer can cancel any recurring payment (which is set to be repeated at specific intervals) or any future payment (which is set to be executed on future dates) if not executed by the service.If the service is canceled upon customer's request or for any other reason, the recurring payment / future payment will be automatically canceled.On termination of the Online Internet Banking Service (Arabi Online), the customer must return the TOKEN device (if any) back to the Bank.Customer can not cancel any financial transaction that was requested and executed using the service.The Internet Banking Service (Arabi Online) allows the customer to request a cheque book which is subject to study by the Bank. In the case it is approved, the customer shall check with the branch with which he/she deals to receive the book, or it will be sent to him/her by mail when he/she agrees to this.If the customer subscribes to the Third Party Funds Transfer Service, by virtue of this application, the customer alone shall bear any responsibility that may arise as a result of debiting his/her account by using the service, or transferring any amount to another customer's account by mistake, and the Bank has the right to deny execution of any transfer request to third parties upon its sole discretion and the customer waives his/her right to raise any objections.i. When the customer selects to subscribe to the Personal Services, the Bank will provide the customer with a sealed envelope containing a User name, First Password to access and operate the service. ii. When the customer logs on to the service for the first time, the service prompts the customer to change his/her User name and First Password mentioned in term (a) above.The customer who subscribed for the Third Party Funds Transfer Service is required to select a second password to confirm the following transactions:Funds Transfers to a third party.Payments to Arab Bank Credit Cards held by a third party.Special Instructions.The customer shall pay the fees / charges set by the Bank for any internal or external funds transfer, Cheque book issuance, balance certificate, bill payment or any other service.If the customer suspects any transaction recorded in his/her financial transactions history / within the service options, the customer must inform the Bank within 15 days, otherwise, the transaction is deemed to be performed on customer's behalf. Once reported the Bank will investigate the matter, and will perform a thorough investigation. The customer will provide the Bank with his/her name, account number and transaction reference number and the customer will be informed of the result of these investigations as soon as possible.The secure mail in the Online Internet Banking Service (Arabi Online), is a means of acceptable dealing between the Bank and the customer The customer must send secure messages to the Bank through this service only. The customer is considered a recipient of any message the Bank sends to the customer through the secure mail, and may not maintain banking confidentially if any information leaks and/or is conveyed to others.Customer can register online to the service by using the dedicated link at Arab Bank Websites and by using his/her visa electron and PIN. The services offered will be limited to the Personal Services.In case the customer entered his/her Visa Electron PIN incorrectly more often than allowed during the online registration, the online registration service will be de-activated and customer can reactivate the service by calling the Customer Contact Center or visiting any branch.The service will be automatically locked in case log in password was entered incorrectly more often than allowed. The customer will have to refer to any of the Bank branches to re-activate the service.In case the customer entered the second password incorrectly more often than allowed, the Third Party Funds Transfer Service will be blocked. Customer can request to unblock / reissue the Third Party Funds Transfer Service by filling an application at any branch.The customer should change the passwords periodically upon receiving them, and he/she is fully responsible for safeguarding his/her Visa Electron Card, User Name, Password(s), PIN and TOKEN device and any other information provided to him/her by the Bank. The customer undertakes to keep the relevant User Name, Password(s), PIN and TOKEN device as confidential and private, and keep them in separate secure places, and not to release them to anyone. The customer should exercise extreme caution when using the service on a PC in a public place or others sets. The Bank shall not assume any responsibility or harm that may arise as a consequence to the misuse of this Service or due to the customer's breach of this obligation.In case customer's TOKEN device is lost/ stolen/ damaged, the customer must report the incident to the Bank immediately so that the Bank will stop the service. To re-activate the service, the customer must apply to issue a new TOKEN device and the customer shall pay any expenses or commissions arising therefrom as decided by the Bank.The customer understands completely that the Visa Electron card number and PIN, user name, passwords and TOKEN are considered the identification means to verify the customer's identity. Therefore, all transactions performed using them and anyone using them will be considered as performed by the customer. The customer shall be liable for all transactions performed by using his/her identification means and responsible for any change, loss or transfer of any of such means to others until such time as the Bank is able to suspend the service by a written notice received from the customer.In case the customer suspects that another party is tampering with his/her accounts through the service, or he/she doubts that his/her Visa Electron card number / PIN, user name and passwords are compromised by some other parties, the customer must inform the Bank of this matter as soon as possible in writing or by the mean agreed upon between the customer and the Bank. The customer shall be liable for any harm that may result due to the use of the Visa Electron card number / PIN, user name and passwords until the date of informing the Bank.Accounts opening through the service:Customer can only open Savings and Current accounts.In case the customer opened a new account, he/she will be committed to transfer the minimum amount required for opening that account.Customer agrees that the same account information, authorized signature and correspondence address of his/her existing account(s) will apply for the new account he/she requested to open using this service.Stopping a cheque(s) using the service:This service allows the customer to stop a cheque(s) which is limited for stolen / lost cheque only, and does not cover disputed cheque(s).In case a customer stopped disputed cheques as stolen or lost, he/she will be fully responsible for this action and the Bank will not be held responsible for any liabilities or consequences that may arise as a result of this action.The Internet Banking Service (Arabi Online) allows the customer to register for Hala Arabi (Phone Banking Service), The registration will be limited to Personal services.The Bank shall have the right to change the instructions after prior notice to the customer (electronically / in writing) to customer's address held with the Bank. If the customer uses the service after the change of the instructions with no written / electronic objection, the customer will be considered as agreeing thereto. Also, the Bank has the right to change the technology used in the service(s) offered without prior notice and without giving any reasons to the customer.The Bank offers the service as per the set Bank Instructions.Jordan Arab Bank PLC Jordan Palestine Egypt Lebanon UAE Qatar Bahrain Yemen Morocco Algeria China South Korea (Representative Office) Kazakhstan (Representative Office) Singapore Subsidiaries Europe Arab Bank plc Arab Bank Australia Limited Islamic international Arab Bank plc Arab National Leasing Company Al - Arabi Investment Group Co.(AB Invest) Arab Sudanese Bank Limited Al Arabi Investment Group / Palestine Acabes For Financial Technology Arab Tunisian Bank Al - Niser Al - Arabi Co.
